forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 53. Southwest wind around 7 mph.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 63, with temperatures falling to around 61 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 7 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco, an ethereal mist lingers gently in the atmosphere, hinting at the embrace of marine fog, which is expected to gradually yield to a brighter embrace. The forecast indicates a pleasantly moderate start to the day with daytime temperatures anticipated to rise to just above a comfortable chill, settling around a mild 63 degrees. The gentle southwest winds whisper of nautical miles traversed, their light caress holding a promise of warming as the sun begins its ascension.

A careful observer would note that while the morning retains a cool, enveloping cloak, the promise of clearer skies as the day unfolds invites urban explorers to don layers that reconcile comfort with adaptability—the soft embrace of a light jacket or sweater may serve well against the lingering chill, especially in the more shaded corners. A day such as this invites strolls through the city’s thriving streets or perhaps a quiet morning spent savoring a warm cup at a local café. With the allure of sunshine peeking through within the hours to come, afternoons could welcome a more relaxed pace, envisioning leisurely walks along the waterfront or unhurried explorations of the bustling markets. Today, with hues of muted gray slowly giving way to warmth, urges a celebration of the urban elegance that is uniquely San Francisco.
